title: Kamindu Mendis bows out of honeymoon for IPL duty
byline: Sri Lankan all-rounder Kamindu Mendis is preparing to arrive in India very soon to play the IPL. With him is likely to be his newly married wife, Nishni. All-rounder Kamindu Mendis married his long-time girlfriend, Nishni, on Monday.

title: Mushfiqur Rahim announces ODI retirement
byline: Bangladesh veteran Mushfiqur Rahim called an end to his One-Day International career on Wednesday (5 March).

title: Litro Gas price revision today
byline: Litro Gas Lanka Limited is to announce a retail price revision for LP gas today for March.

title: Air quality deteriorates to moderate level
byline: The Vehicular Emission Test Trust Fund of the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) issued a warning regarding the deterioration of air quality to a moderate level.

title: Customs clarifies hybrid vehicle fuel tax controversy
byline: Sri Lanka Customs (SLC) has refuted false information circulating about the imposition of a fuel tax on hybrid vehicles during customs clearance.

title: CID arrests Mervyn Silva over forged land case
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva has been arrested by officers from the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) at his residence in Pelawatte, Battaramulla last night (05).

title: SEC and Central Bank warn public of rising investment schemes
byline: The Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka (SEC) has recently raised concerns about a growing trend of investment schemes promoting offshore market opportunities.

title: Tax fears likely fuelling Sri Lanka’s cash surge, hindering digital shift
byline: The fear of taxation may be contributing to the recent increase in cash circulation, highlighting Sri Lanka’s long journey towards a less cash-dependent society.

title: Daisy Forrest released on bail
byline: Daisy Forrest, also known as ’Daisy Achchi’, the grandmother of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa’s son, Yoshitha Rajapaksa, was released on bail by the Kaduwela Magistrate today.

title: Naked motorcycle rider found to be mentally disturbed: Police
byline: The man who was arrested for riding a motorcycle while naked was found to be suffering from a mental disorder, Police Media Spokesman SSP Buddhika Manathunga said.

title: Man destroys property, threatens staff at Hambantota Provincial Council in viral video
byline: A viral video circulating on social media shows a man allegedly destroying property at the Provincial Council in Hambantota.

title: Couple thwarted from smuggling Rs.5.8 Mn worth illicit fags into country
byline: A man and a woman returning from the Middle East were nabbed by the police at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning for attempting to smuggle in illicit cigarettes worth over Rs.5.8 million.

title: Drug legalisation in Israel increases addiction among Sri Lankan workers: Ambassador
byline: Since drug trafficking has been legalised in Israel, access to drugs has increased. As a result, some Sri Lankans living in Israel have become addicted to substances such as ice and marijuana, leading to mental confusion, Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the State of Israel Nimal Bandara said.

title: 19 shooting incidents, 68 suspects arrested
byline: A total of 19 shooting incidents have been reported this year, with 12 linked to organized crime and 7 resulting from personal disputes, raising concerns over public safety and security.

title: Government assures court of measures to reduce air pollution
byline: The Attorney General informed the Court of Appeal today that the authorities will take the necessary measures to reduce air pollution across the country, including in the Jaffna district.

title: Court staff member further remanded over disappearance of heroin from storeroom
byline: The court staff member who was arrested over the alleged disappearance of 12 kilos of heroin worth over Rs. 120 million, which was kept in the storeroom of the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court, was today ordered to be further remanded till March 20 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.

title: Former Presidents destroyed SLRC, ITN: Ruling party MP
byline: Former Presidents have destroyed state TV channels ITN and SLRC during the past years, ruling party MP Jagath Manuwarna told Parliament today.

title: Railway construction in wildlife habitats increases elephant-train collisions: CEJ
byline: Due to the construction of railways through wildlife habitats, elephant collisions with trains have increased significantly, the Centre for Environmental Justice (CEJ) said.

title: Police seek public assistance to locate Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: Police today requested the public to inform of any whereabouts of former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon who is evading arrest.

title: North Korea halts tourism just weeks after reopening
byline: North Korea has stopped tourists from visiting, just weeks after the first Western tourists entered the country for the first time in five years.

title: Include healthcare as fundamental right in Constitution: Sajith proposes
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today proposed that health and healthcare facilities be included in the Constitution as a fundamental right just as civic and political rights.

title: Trump issues 'last warning' to Hamas as US confirms direct hostage talks
byline: US President Donald Trump has issued what he called a ’’last warning’’ to Hamas to release the hostages being held in Gaza.

title: Wild elephant knocks on doors at night, turns aggressive if not opened
byline: A wild elephant in the Kekirawa area is reportedly exhibiting unusual behaviour—knocking on doors at night and becoming aggressive when residents do not open them.

title: Six more arrested in Mervyn’s land scam
byline: Another six more individuals have been arrested for defrauding Rs. 75 million by preparing forged documents for a 0.2137 hectare land belonging to the Kelaniya Pradeshiya Sabha, the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) said.

title: Live Updates- 146th Battle of the Blues 2025 - Day 01
byline: The 146th Battle of the Blues annual cricket encounter between Royal College, Colombo and S. Thomas’ College, Mount Lavinia will be played on the 6th, 7th and 8th March at SSC Grounds, Colombo.

title: National Media Policy to become effective by June this year
byline: The Government intends to introduce a National Media Policy by June this year, Minister of Mass Media Nalinda Jayatissa told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka will need primary healthcare centres every 2 kms soon: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka will need primary healthcare centres every 2 kms because of the increase in the spread of non-communicable diceases and the aging population, Minister of Health Nalinda Jayatissa told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka raises alarm over rising Colorectal Cancer cases
byline: Sri Lanka has raised concern over a significant increase in Colorectal cancer, with 3,000 patients reported, the Health Ministry said.

title: Are our elephants safe?
byline: Amidst the rising population of wild elephants in Sri Lanka and the alarming rate of elephant deaths, reckless tourism practices continue to endanger these tuskers and disrupt their natural habitats.

title: Ranil unhappy with Al Jazeera interview, questions integrity of panelists
byline: Expressing his dissatisfaction with the interview with Al Jazewera which was released on social media today, Former President Ranil Wickremeisnghe raised questions on the panelists of the interview.

title: Expedite compensation payments for crop damages: President instructs officials
byline: President Anura Kumara Disanayake has instructed relevant officials to expedite the process of providing compensation for crop damages caused by recent heavy rains and natural disasters.

title: President stresses need for uninterrupted fertiliser supply for Yala season
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasised the need for a continuous and uninterrupted supply of fertiliser to agricultural lands during the Yala season, ensuring there are no shortages.

title: Royal College Principal tenders apology
byline: Principal of Royal College Colombo L.W.K. Silva tendered an apology for the misbehaviour of several children of his school yesterday.

title: New chairman appointed to SLTB
byline: Jewaka Prasanna Purasinghe has assumed duties as the Chairman of the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) with effect from today.

title: Mervyn Silva, two others remanded until March 17
byline: Former Minister Mervyn Silva and two others have been remanded by the Mahara Magistrate’s Court until March 17.

title: Naked motorcycle rider found to be suffering from mental health condition: Police
byline: The man who was arrested for riding a motorcycle while naked was found to be suffering from a mental health condition, Police Media Spokesman SSP Buddhika Manathunga said.

title: Catholic Church denounce insult on cross by students of Royal College
byline: The Catholic Church in Sri Lanka today expressed their displeasure regarding the actions of students of Royal College in Colombo, calling it an insult to the cross which Christians consider sacred.

title: Sri Lanka to host India and South Africa in a tri-nation series
byline: The three women’s team will be in action in the 50-over tournament in Sri Lanka.
